pullRequest.title: Add RenameShapes model transformer
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds a RenameShapes model transformer that takes a map of ShapeId to ShapeId pairs.
Shape members are updated for consistency when any member-containing aggregate shape has been renamed.
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

nodes.bodyText:
If you're going to mutate this map, then you need to copy it first in the constructor in case the map you were provided is unmodifiable.
Can you add a comment in code to say what this is doing?
nit: extra blank line
nit: extra blank line

nit: add opening

tags for each newline after the first.

nit: add

tags for each newline/paragraph after the first one
Would love to see a comment to outline what's about to happen. "This transformer first converts the model to a Node using the JSON AST format. This approach was chosen because X."

Using a ModelAssembler really needs the ability to specify a custom classloader (for loading things like traits).... or maybe we use a Supplier that creates ModelAssemblers. We did a similar thing in smithy-build. That should probably be an optional argument to this class and an overload in the ModelTransformer.
nit: put each "." on a new line to make this easier to read
nit: put a newline between test setup and test assertions
nit: You don't need to specify the type parameters on the right hand side of this statement.
nit: I would avoid using esoteric map features like this for readability. Just create a map, then put things in it on separate lines. It's actually fewer lines and more clear that way.

For this integration test, I'd like to see metadata getting renamed (e.g., a suppression) and tests for virtually every kind of shape and reference -- structures, lists, maps, sets, unions, services, operations, etc.
Nit: this kind of setup typically would go in the constructor, but given the other suggestion to just require that one is passed in to the class, this can go away.
Nit: for readability, you could assign the rewritten node to a variable then pass that variable into the addDocumentNode method.
I suggest that you call the overloaded renameShapes method and pass in a default version of the supplier (e.g., Model::assembler).
